sap.suite.ui.microchart.ComparisonMicroC.description:
Illustrates values as colored bar charts with title, numeric value, and scaling factor in the content area. This control replaces the deprecated sap.suite.ui.commons.ComparisonChart.
Note: You can assign a custom tooltip for this microchart. The custom tooltip can be set using expression binding. When no custom tooltip is defined, the tooltip is generated automatically based on the logic described in {@link sap.ui.core.Element#getTooltip_AsString}. For a combination of a generated and a custom tooltip, use ((AltText)) inside of the tooltip string. The aggregated data of the microchart can also be customized.
sap.suite.ui.microchart.ComparisonMicroC.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ComparisonMicroChart control. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSize size} : sap.m.Size (default: Auto)
    • {@link #getScale scale} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getMinValue minValue} : float
    • {@link #getMaxValue maxValue} : float
    • {@link #getView view} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.ComparisonMicroChartViewType (default: Normal)
    • {@link #getColorPalette colorPalette} : string[] (default: [])
    • {@link #getShrinkable shrinkable} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getIsResponsive isResponsive} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getData data} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.ComparisonMicroChartData[] (default)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.suite.ui.microchart.ComparisonMicroC.helpDescription:
Illustrates values as colored bar charts with title, numeric value, and scaling factor in the content area. This control replaces the deprecated sap.suite.ui.commons.ComparisonChart.
Note: You can assign a custom tooltip for this microchart. The custom tooltip can be set using expression binding. When no custom tooltip is defined, the tooltip is generated automatically based on the logic described in {@link sap.ui.core.Element#getTooltip_AsString}. For a combination of a generated and a custom tooltip, use ((AltText)) inside of the tooltip string. The aggregated data of the microchart can also be customized.

sap.suite.ui.microchart.BulletMicroChart.description:
Displays a colored horizontal bar representing a current value on top of a background bar representing the compared value. The vertical bars can represent the numeric values, the scaling factors, the thresholds, and the target values. This control replaces the deprecated sap.suite.ui.commons.BulletChart.
Note: You can assign a custom tooltip for this microchart. The custom tooltip can be set using expression binding. When no custom tooltip is defined, the tooltip is generated automatically based on the logic described in {@link sap.ui.core.Element#getTooltip_AsString}. For a combination of a generated and a custom tooltip, use ((AltText)) inside of the tooltip string. The aggregated data of the microchart can also be customized.
sap.suite.ui.microchart.BulletMicroChart.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new BulletMicroChart control. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSize size} : sap.m.Size (default: Auto)
    • {@link #getMode mode} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.BulletMicroChartModeType (default: Actual)
    • {@link #getScale scale} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getForecastValue forecastValue} : float
    • {@link #getTargetValue targetValue} : float
    • {@link #getMinValue minValue} : float
    • {@link #getMaxValue maxValue} : float
    • {@link #getShowActualValue showActualValue} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowDeltaValue showDeltaValue} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowActualValueInDeltaMode showActualValueInDeltaMode} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowTargetValue showTargetValue} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowValueMarker showValueMarker} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowThresholds showThresholds} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getActualValueLabel actualValueLabel} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getDeltaValueLabel deltaValueLabel} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getTargetValueLabel targetValueLabel} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getScaleColor scaleColor} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.CommonBackgroundType (default: MediumLight)
    • {@link #getIsResponsive isResponsive} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getActual actual} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.BulletMicroChartData (default)
    • {@link #getThresholds thresholds} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.BulletMicroChartData[]
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.suite.ui.microchart.BulletMicroChart.helpDescription:
Displays a colored horizontal bar representing a current value on top of a background bar representing the compared value. The vertical bars can represent the numeric values, the scaling factors, the thresholds, and the target values. This control replaces the deprecated sap.suite.ui.commons.BulletChart.
Note: You can assign a custom tooltip for this microchart. The custom tooltip can be set using expression binding. When no custom tooltip is defined, the tooltip is generated automatically based on the logic described in {@link sap.ui.core.Element#getTooltip_AsString}. For a combination of a generated and a custom tooltip, use ((AltText)) inside of the tooltip string. The aggregated data of the microchart can also be customized.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. sap.suite.ui.microchart.HarveyBallMicroC.description:
A radial chart that displays a value compared to its total.
Unlike a pie chart, which shows multiple values or sectors, a Harvey Ball microchart shows only one value from a total.
The sector that represents a value being compared to a total is defined by {@link sap.suite.ui.microchart.HarveyBallMicroChartItem}.
Note: You can assign a custom tooltip for this microchart. The custom tooltip can be set using expression binding. When no custom tooltip is defined, the tooltip is generated automatically based on the logic described in {@link sap.ui.core.Element#getTooltip_AsString}. For a combination of a generated and a custom tooltip, use ((AltText)) inside of the tooltip string. The aggregated data of the microchart can also be customized.
sap.suite.ui.microchart.HarveyBallMicroC.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new HarveyBallMicroChart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTotal total} : float
    • {@link #getTotalLabel totalLabel} : string
    • {@link #getTotalScale totalScale} : string
    • {@link #getFormattedLabel formattedLabel} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowTotal showTotal} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowFractions showFractions} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getSize size} : sap.m.Size (default: Auto)
    • {@link #getColorPalette colorPalette} : string[] (default: [])
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getAlignContent alignContent} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.HorizontalAlignmentType (default: Left)
    • {@link #getIsResponsive isResponsive} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.HarveyBallMicroChartItem[] (default)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.suite.ui.microchart.HarveyBallMicroC.helpDescription:
A radial chart that displays a value compared to its total.
Unlike a pie chart, which shows multiple values or sectors, a Harvey Ball microchart shows only one value from a total.
The sector that represents a value being compared to a total is defined by {@link sap.suite.ui.microchart.HarveyBallMicroChartItem}.
Note: You can assign a custom tooltip for this microchart. The custom tooltip can be set using expression binding. When no custom tooltip is defined, the tooltip is generated automatically based on the logic described in {@link sap.ui.core.Element#getTooltip_AsString}. For a combination of a generated and a custom tooltip, use ((AltText)) inside of the tooltip string. The aggregated data of the microchart can also be customized.

sap.suite.ui.microchart.RadialMicroChart.description:
Displays a ring chart highlighting a current status. The status is displayed with a semantically colored radial bar and a percentage value.
Note: You can assign a custom tooltip for this microchart. The custom tooltip can be set using expression binding. When no custom tooltip is defined, the tooltip is generated automatically based on the logic described in {@link sap.ui.core.Element#getTooltip_AsString}. For a combination of a generated and a custom tooltip, use ((AltText)) inside of the tooltip string.
sap.suite.ui.microchart.RadialMicroChart.constructorDescription:
Describes the configuration of the graphic element on the chart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTotal total} : float
    • {@link #getFraction fraction} : float
    • {@link #getPercentage percentage} : float
    • {@link #getValueColor valueColor} : sap.m.ValueCSSColor (default: Neutral)
    • {@link #getSize size} : sap.m.Size (default: Auto)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getAlignContent alignContent} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.HorizontalAlignmentType (default: Left)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.suite.ui.microchart.RadialMicroChart.helpDescription:
Displays a ring chart highlighting a current status. The status is displayed with a semantically colored radial bar and a percentage value.
Note: You can assign a custom tooltip for this microchart. The custom tooltip can be set using expression binding. When no custom tooltip is defined, the tooltip is generated automatically based on the logic described in {@link sap.ui.core.Element#getTooltip_AsString}. For a combination of a generated and a custom tooltip, use ((AltText)) inside of the tooltip string.

Illustrates values as stacked and colored bar charts displaying numeric values (as absolute values or percentages) inside the bars.
Note: You can assign a custom tooltip for this microchart. The custom tooltip can be set using expression binding. When no custom tooltip is defined, the tooltip is generated automatically based on the logic described in {@link sap.ui.core.Element#getTooltip_AsString}. For a combination of a generated and a custom tooltip, use ((AltText)) inside of the tooltip string. The aggregated data of the microchart can also be customized.

See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSize size} : sap.m.Size (default: Auto)

sap.suite.ui.microchart.StackedBarMicroC.helpDescription:
Illustrates values as stacked and colored bar charts displaying numeric values (as absolute values or percentages) inside the bars.
Note: You can assign a custom tooltip for this microchart. The custom tooltip can be set using expression binding. When no custom tooltip is defined, the tooltip is generated automatically based on the logic described in {@link sap.ui.core.Element#getTooltip_AsString}. For a combination of a generated and a custom tooltip, use ((AltText)) inside of the tooltip string. The aggregated data of the microchart can also be customized.

maxValue.description: The maximum value can be set to scale StackedBarMicroChartBar values to the same base. If maxValue is smaller than the sum of all StackedMicroChartBar values, the maxValue is ignored. All values are shown as percentage values (same behavior as maxValue is not used). If maxValue is equal or bigger than the sum of all StackedMicroChartBars, all values are scaled to the value of maxValue and the percentage mode is turned off. Absolute values are shown instead. The difference between the sum and maxValue is shown as invisible bar, thus e.g. different StackedBarMicroChart instances can be compared.

The difference between the sum and maxValue is shown as invisible bar, thus e.g. different StackedBarMicroChart instances can be compared.

    • {@link #getSelectionEnabled selectionEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getPoints points} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.InteractiveLineChartPoint[] (default)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectionChanged selectionChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

sap.suite.ui.microchart.LineMicroChart.description:
Chart that displays the history of values as segmented lines along a threshold line. The scale is optional and showing the points is also optional.
Note: You can assign a custom tooltip for this microchart. The custom tooltip can be set using expression binding. When no custom tooltip is defined, the tooltip is generated automatically based on the logic described in {@link sap.ui.core.Element#getTooltip_AsString}. For a combination of a generated and a custom tooltip, use ((AltText)) inside of the tooltip string.
sap.suite.ui.microchart.LineMicroChart.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new LineMicroChart control. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSize size} : sap.m.Size (default: Auto)
    • {@link #getThreshold threshold} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getShowThresholdLine showThresholdLine} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowThresholdValue showThresholdValue} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getThresholdDisplayValue thresholdDisplayValue} : string
    • {@link #getMinXValue minXValue} : float
    • {@link #getMaxXValue maxXValue} : float
    • {@link #getMinYValue minYValue} : float
    • {@link #getMaxYValue maxYValue} : float
    • {@link #getLeftTopLabel leftTopLabel} : string
    • {@link #getRightTopLabel rightTopLabel} : string
    • {@link #getLeftBottomLabel leftBottomLabel} : string
    • {@link #getRightBottomLabel rightBottomLabel} : string
    • {@link #getShowTopLabels showTopLabels} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowBottomLabels showBottomLabels} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getColor color} : any (default: Neutral)
    • {@link #getShowPoints showPoints} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getPoints points} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.LineMicroChartPoint[] (default)
    • {@link #getLines lines} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.LineMicroChartLine[]
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.suite.ui.microchart.LineMicroChart.helpDescription:
Chart that displays the history of values as segmented lines along a threshold line. The scale is optional and showing the points is also optional.
Note: You can assign a custom tooltip for this microchart. The custom tooltip can be set using expression binding. When no custom tooltip is defined, the tooltip is generated automatically based on the logic described in {@link sap.ui.core.Element#getTooltip_AsString}. For a combination of a generated and a custom tooltip, use ((AltText)) inside of the tooltip string.

points.description:
Aggregation that contains all data points that should be provided in an ordered way. If both the points and lines aggregations are used, the chart is rendered based on the points aggregation, while the lines from the lines aggregations are ignored.
The points aggregation can be used to ensure backward compatibility. However in general, the lines aggregation should be preferred.
points.helpDescription:
Aggregation that contains all data points that should be provided in an ordered way. If both the points and lines aggregations are used, the chart is rendered based on the points aggregation, while the lines from the lines aggregations are ignored.
The points aggregation can be used to ensure backward compatibility. However in general, the lines aggregation should be preferred.

showThresholdLine.description: If this property is set to false, the threshold line is hidden.
showThresholdLine.helpDescription: If this property is set to false, the threshold line is hidden.

color.description:
Describes the color of the chart.
In conjunction with emphasized points, it is only used if all points have the sap.m.ValueColor.Neutral color.
The color can be set as an {@link sap.m.ValueCSSColor} or as a plain object. It has the 'above|' and 'below' properties that determine the color of the graph above and below the threshold, respectively.
The color property of {@link sap.suite.ui.microchart.LineMicroChartLine} has priority over this property in case it is set.
color.helpDescription:
Describes the color of the chart.
In conjunction with emphasized points, it is only used if all points have the sap.m.ValueColor.Neutral color.
The color can be set as an {@link sap.m.ValueCSSColor} or as a plain object. It has the 'above|' and 'below' properties that determine the color of the graph above and below the threshold, respectively.
The color property of {@link sap.suite.ui.microchart.LineMicroChartLine} has priority over this property in case it is set.

showPoints.description:
Defines if the control renders the points or not.
If emphasized points are used, there is no effect.
If the value is true, the points in the aggregation are shown.
The showPoints property of the {@link sap.suite.ui.microchart.LineMicroChartLine} control has priority over this property in case it is set.
showPoints.helpDescription:
Defines if the control renders the points or not.
If emphasized points are used, there is no effect.
If the value is true, the points in the aggregation are shown.
The showPoints property of the {@link sap.suite.ui.microchart.LineMicroChartLine} control has priority over this property in case it is set.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

sap.suite.ui.microchart.ColumnMicroChart.description:
Compares different values which are represented as vertical bars. This control replaces the deprecated sap.suite.ui.commons.ColumnMicroChart.
Note: You can assign a custom tooltip for this microchart. The custom tooltip can be set using expression binding. When no custom tooltip is defined, the tooltip is generated automatically based on the logic described in {@link sap.ui.core.Element#getTooltip_AsString}. For a combination of a generated and a custom tooltip, use ((AltText)) inside of the tooltip string. The aggregated data of the microchart can also be customized.
sap.suite.ui.microchart.ColumnMicroChart.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ColumnMicroChart control. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSize size} : sap.m.Size (default: Auto)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getIsResponsive isResponsive} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowTopLabels showTopLabels} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowBottomLabels showBottomLabels} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getAllowColumnLabels allowColumnLabels} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getColumns columns} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.ColumnMicroChartData[] (default)
    • {@link #getLeftTopLabel leftTopLabel} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.ColumnMicroChartLabel
    • {@link #getRightTopLabel rightTopLabel} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.ColumnMicroChartLabel
    • {@link #getLeftBottomLabel leftBottomLabel} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.ColumnMicroChartLabel
    • {@link #getRightBottomLabel rightBottomLabel} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.ColumnMicroChartLabel
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.suite.ui.microchart.ColumnMicroChart.helpDescription:
Compares different values which are represented as vertical bars. This control replaces the deprecated sap.suite.ui.commons.ColumnMicroChart.
Note: You can assign a custom tooltip for this microchart. The custom tooltip can be set using expression binding. When no custom tooltip is defined, the tooltip is generated automatically based on the logic described in {@link sap.ui.core.Element#getTooltip_AsString}. For a combination of a generated and a custom tooltip, use ((AltText)) inside of the tooltip string. The aggregated data of the microchart can also be customized.

These interactive features provide more information on a chart value. For example, by selecting a bar you can get more details on the displayed value.
sap.suite.ui.microchart.InteractiveBarCh.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new InteractiveBarChart control. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getDisplayedBars displayedBars} : int (default: 3)
    • {@link #getLabelWidth labelWidth} : sap.ui.core.Percentage (default: 40%)
    • {@link #getSelectionEnabled selectionEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getMin min} : float
    • {@link #getMax max} : float
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getBars bars} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.InteractiveBarChartBar[] (default)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectionChanged selectionChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

sap.suite.ui.microchart.AreaMicroChart.description: Note: You can assign a custom tooltip for this microchart. The custom tooltip can be set using expression binding. When no custom tooltip is defined, the tooltip is generated automatically based on the logic described in {@link sap.ui.core.Element#getTooltip_AsString}. For a combination of a generated and a custom tooltip, use ((AltText)) inside of the tooltip string. The aggregated data of the microchart can also be customized.
sap.suite.ui.microchart.AreaMicroChart.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new AreaMicroChart control. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSize size} : sap.m.Size (default: Auto)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getMaxXValue maxXValue} : float
    • {@link #getMinXValue minXValue} : float
    • {@link #getMaxYValue maxYValue} : float
    • {@link #getMinYValue minYValue} : float
    • {@link #getView view} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.AreaMicroChartViewType (default: Normal)
    • {@link #getColorPalette colorPalette} : string[] (default: [])
    • {@link #getShowLabel showLabel} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getIsResponsive isResponsive} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getChart chart} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.AreaMicroChartItem
    • {@link #getMaxThreshold maxThreshold} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.AreaMicroChartItem
    • {@link #getInnerMaxThreshold innerMaxThreshold} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.AreaMicroChartItem
    • {@link #getInnerMinThreshold innerMinThreshold} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.AreaMicroChartItem
    • {@link #getMinThreshold minThreshold} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.AreaMicroChartItem
    • {@link #getTarget target} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.AreaMicroChartItem
    • {@link #getFirstXLabel firstXLabel} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.AreaMicroChartLabel
    • {@link #getFirstYLabel firstYLabel} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.AreaMicroChartLabel
    • {@link #getLastXLabel lastXLabel} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.AreaMicroChartLabel
    • {@link #getLastYLabel lastYLabel} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.AreaMicroChartLabel
    • {@link #getMaxLabel maxLabel} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.AreaMicroChartLabel
    • {@link #getMinLabel minLabel} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.AreaMicroChartLabel
    • {@link #getLines lines} : sap.suite.ui.microchart.AreaMicroChartItem[] (default)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.suite.ui.microchart.AreaMicroChart.helpDescription: Note: You can assign a custom tooltip for this microchart. The custom tooltip can be set using expression binding. When no custom tooltip is defined, the tooltip is generated automatically based on the logic described in {@link sap.ui.core.Element#getTooltip_AsString}. For a combination of a generated and a custom tooltip, use ((AltText)) inside of the tooltip string. The aggregated data of the microchart can also be customized.

customData.description: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.
customData.helpDescription: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.

dependents.description: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.
dependents.helpDescription: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.

dragDropConfig.description: Defines the drag-and-drop configuration. Note: This configuration might be ignored due to control {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend metadata} restrictions.
dragDropConfig.helpDescription: Defines the drag-and-drop configuration. Note: This configuration might be ignored due to control {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend metadata} restrictions.

points.description:
Aggregation that contains all data points that should be provided in an ordered way.
Note: Points can be bound without template/factory method.
This approach is more efficient when many points are used, because no new objects will be created for them and only their representation in the model will be kept. See the {@link https://ui5.sap.com/#/sample/sap.suite.ui.microchart.sample.LineMicroChartBinding/preview samples}.
To use emphasized points, the emphasized property has to be set in the model of the point and can be used together with the properties show and color, as shown in the sample. When this binding method is used, the #getPoints method will always return an empty array.
points.helpDescription:

Note: Points can be bound without template/factory method.
This approach is more efficient when many points are used, because no new objects will be created for them and only their representation in the model will be kept. See the {@link https://ui5.sap.com/#/sample/sap.suite.ui.microchart.sample.LineMicroChartBinding/preview samples}.
To use emphasized points, the emphasized property has to be set in the model of the point and can be used together with the properties show and color, as shown in the sample. When this binding method is used, the #getPoints method will always return an empty array.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

color.description:
Defines the color of the chart.
In conjunction with emphasized points, this property is only used if all points have the {@link sap.m.ValueColor.Neutral} color. The color can be set as an {@link sap.m.ValueCSSColor} or as a plain object. It has the above and below properties that determine the color of the graph above and below the threshold, respectively.
This property has priority over the property color of {@link sap.suite.ui.microchart.LineMicroChart} in case it is set.
If this property is not defined, the value of the color property from the parent {@link sap.suite.ui.microchart.LineMicroChart} is used instead.
color.helpDescription:
Defines the color of the chart.
In conjunction with emphasized points, this property is only used if all points have the {@link sap.m.ValueColor.Neutral} color. The color can be set as an {@link sap.m.ValueCSSColor} or as a plain object. It has the above and below properties that determine the color of the graph above and below the threshold, respectively.
This property has priority over the property color of {@link sap.suite.ui.microchart.LineMicroChart} in case it is set.
If this property is not defined, the value of the color property from the parent {@link sap.suite.ui.microchart.LineMicroChart} is used instead.

showPoints.description:
Defines whether the points are shown.
If emphasized points are used, this property is ignored.
If this property is set to true, the points in the points aggregation are shown.
This property has priority over the property showPoints of {@link sap.suite.ui.microchart.LineMicroChart} in case it is set.
If this property is not defined, the showPoints property of the {@link sap.suite.ui.microchart.LineMicroChart} is used instead.

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.
